page.title: 15 Killingworth Village
page.content: George Stephenson is connected with Killingworth, for he was an engineer at Killingwoth Colliery. He tried out his first engine on the old Killingworth Wagon Way. There is a memorial stone at the top of the village. Sandra Black Lawrence Cant Killingworth was a mining village- two pubs, a shop, and a few pit cottages. In winter, people used to go skating on pond. When there was horse-racing at Gosforth Park the horses were brought to Killingworth Station, then walked up the road to Gosforth Park. People's lives have changed as well. On washing day children's mothers would give them tuppence to get their tea, corned beef from the shop. They would have a bath once a week. They would have it in a bath in front of the fire. Kerry Brydon
